flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=120>>120 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+120=<<2400+120=2520>>2520 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 2520/3=<<2520/3=840>>840 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 2520-840=<<2520-840=1680>>1680 remaining bottles of wine.
#### 1680

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 120. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
